intro: Bahia ambigua, commonly known as the ambiguous bahia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and stamens. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
